metadata.title: CVE-2023-6176 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel API for thecryptographic algorithm scatterwalk functionality. This issue occurs when auser constructs a malicious packet with specific socket configuration,which could allow a local user to crash the system or escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-169-generic - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-5.4.0-169-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-169-generic - 5.4.0-169.187
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-169-lowlatency - 5.4.0-169.187
No subscription required
